questions.question: I saw that .................... yesterday.
questions.description: When we want to use a possessive with a demonstrative (this / that), we use a construction with of + possessive.

questions.question: She is a .........................
questions.description: When we want to use an article with a possessive, we use a construction with of + possessive.

questions.question: That bag must be .................
questions.description: Her is a possessive adjective. It goes before a noun. Hers is a possessive pronoun. It can stand alone.

questions.question: The dog is happy. ................. just had .............. breakfast.
questions.description: It’s means it is or it has. Its is a possessive word like his or her.

questions.question: ................... has just invited me to her party.
questions.description: We cannot use a possessive after an article. Instead we use a structure with of.

questions.question: How is that ......................?
questions.description: We cannot use a possessive after an demonstrative adjective. Instead we use a structure with of.

questions.question: Other people’s lives always seem more exciting than ................
questions.description: One’s cannot be used as a pronoun. Instead we use one’s own.

questions.question: Did you like this new idea ..................?
questions.description: We cannot usually use a possessive with another determiner. Instead we use a structure with ‘of+ possessive’.

questions.question: That ...................... has drunk all the milk.
questions.description: We cannot usually use a possessive with another determiner. Instead we use a structure with ‘of+ possessive’.

questions.question: It is easy to lose ................ temper when one is criticized.
questions.description: One's is a possessive form like his or her.

questions.question: The teacher asked the students to submit their .................
questions.description: After a plural determiner, we normally use a plural pronoun.
